content.raw:
I think there is a slight behavior change, just want to confirm if that's intended. Originally, when a link is scaled, it's inertia is also scaled relatively instead of being recomputed based on the new size, e.g.

* old behavior: insert a box and change inertia values from `0.1666667` to `0.01`. Scale the link slowly and see the values goes up and down around `0.01`. 

* new behavior: the inertia values get reset back to `0.1666667` when the link is scaled.
content.html:
I think there is a slight behavior change, just want to confirm if that's intended. Originally, when a link is scaled, it's inertia is also scaled relatively instead of being recomputed based on the new size, e.g.

  • old behavior: insert a box and change inertia values from 0.1666667 to 0.01. Scale the link slowly and see the values goes up and down around 0.01.

  • new behavior: the inertia values get reset back to 0.1666667 when the link is scaled.
